item.description:
TETSUO: THE BULLET MAN (NR)
(Japan, 2010) Director: Shinya Tsukamoto. Screenplay by Shinya Tsukamoto/Hisakatsu Kuroki. Cast: Eric Bossick, Akiko Monô, Shinya Tsukamoto, Stephen Sarrazin.

The third installment in Shinya Tsukamoto’s cyberpunk Tetsuo series lives up to the original Iron Man, with its dark, stylized version of a Tokyo capable of turning an ordinary salaryman into a deadly machine. Anthony is an American living in Japan whose happy bubble pops when his son is run down by a killer in a car. Urged on by his reclusive Japanese wife, he allows his thirst for vengeance to transform him into something more metallic than human... The first Tsukamoto film shot in English, featuring a new song by Nine Inch Nails, played to raves at the Tribeca Film Festival. “a work of twisted genius by a master at the top of his game...it’s pure cyber cinema!” Raffi Asdourian, thefilmstage.com
http://www.ifcfilms.com/ifc-midnight
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be waiting in the lobby. Film is 9:45 pm.
item.why: And you thought that Ironman was a Marvel comic. See the original inspiration.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: Tetsuo: The Bullet Man
